did.abstract: The Mark Nepo Papers contain a manuscript and research materials related to his literary career.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection includes hand written research notes and drafts, poems, and publications.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Mark Nepo donated print and audio books that he authored that will be separately cataloged for the book division of Special Collections.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically. There are no series.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mark Nepo is a poet and philosopher who has taught in the fields of poetry and spirituality for more than 30 years. A New York Times best selling author, he has published 22 books and recorded 15 audio projects.
Nepo graduated from the University at Albany with a Doctor of Arts in English in 1980 and taught in the English Department for 18 years.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Mark Nepo donated all materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in December 2019.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The rights to published works of Mark Nepo are held according to applicable copyright laws.
The rights to any unpublished manuscripts and electronic papers of Mark Nepo in this collection share non-exclusive rights between the University Libraries, Mark Nepo, and his Literary Trust.

Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
